text: <@U03P46V3WUQ> By the way, you have a general `contact` object, that can be used as well. See documentation for details: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/variables#general-variables>
Is there any documented or undocumented method to print the original source of the template (unrendered)?

Hi, I've got a bare bones HTML + HubL template - what is the proper way to create links between pages using HubL?

Eg. I tried `<a href="{{ get_asset_url('/theme/templates/contact.html') }}">Contact Us</a>`
But this results in linking to the template file, rather than the published page (that was created using that template).

I'm assuming there's some sort of HubL syntax that allows me to point to the published page in a way that isn't hard-coded, such that if the published page slug/url gets changed the links won't break?

You need to create a page which contains the content (url, meta title, featured image, and body copy) that is flowed into your template. Navigation can be done with a navigation menu. The nav menu is a visual tool to connect and link your pages. This works just like WordPress. each url has an ID.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/menus-and-navigation|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/menus-and-navigation>
Thanks! What would you recommend if the menu wasn't as straightforward? Say, a 'mega-menu', similar to what they do at <http://asana.com|asana.com> (see the "Why Asana?" dropdown)
I would experiment using the menu system and seeing how it's nested ul li

In this case, I was thinking the menu would be more hard coded (ie. wouldn't allow for the ability for the child items to be dragged around to be repositioned), but I didn't know how to allow for the links themselves to be designed as 'pointers to page locations in HubSpot', rather than hard coded URLs which wouldn't be as robust if the page names were to change.
You might need to use JavaScript to modify or build your menu
Or you could create a custom module and write your own markup
Ah ok, I'll dig into the custom module stuff
Nav menu aside, if there's a simple hyperlink within page A that is intended to link to page B, do you know if there's a simple built in module that is designed for this purpose?
(I was thinking maybe similar to the "@HubSpot/button" module, but even more basic to just grab the url itself without the surrounding <a> tags)
I can't think of a default one but that could be an easy one to make. That is the fun part of custom module fields. You can output only what you need.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields>
Link or page Fields would work

Cool, I'll look into the custom modules - thanks for pointing me in the right direction! I'm new to this, so I just wanted to make sure I wasn't doing something that's 'overkill' in case there was a commonplace solution I wasn't aware of
You're welcome. Often there are a few ways to build things. I often have to stop myself though and think what would a non technical person do or expect.
Its usually clunky for me but makes sense to them

Yeah that makes sense. For us, we're in a bit of an odd situation since for editing purposes we want it to be easy to understand for traditional developers (ie. the less hubl the better), but yet we want everything hosted within HubSpot for our marketers to be able to take advantage of all the other marketing-related features. So I guess my challenge is how to figure out the balance between the two :slightly_smiling_face:
Oh cool. If you need anymore help you can dm me and I will try and help. Have a nice weekend
Thanks, you too! Appreciate all your help today
